intro: Acetosella obtriangulata, commonly known as the triangular sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically triangular in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, and it thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. Acetosella obtriangulata is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
